Social Media Manager Job at DL Luxury




        
    

        
        DL Luxury is a small but growing business that specializes in spirit based reed diffusers, car scents, and air fresheners. We also support Airbnb apartment owners by supplying home fragrances and helping them find suitable staff to maintain their spaces. Our goal is to create fresh, welcoming, and luxurious environments at affordable prices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Asokoro, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Social Media Strategy & Management
	Social Media Ads for Page Growth
	Content Creation & Design
	Community Voice & Engagement
	Reporting & Growth.


Must-Have Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree
	1 - 5 years of experience managing social media for a brand.
	Proficiency in running social media Ads and facilitating page followers growth
	Proficiency in Canva, CapCut (bonus if you’ve used templates, brand kits, and animations) and other editing apps
	Familiarity with Instagram, TikTok, Threads, and basic video editing
	Strong copywriting skills and deep understanding of Nigerian cultural references, humor, and slang
	Experience engaging diaspora audiences or working with immigrant communities.


Nice-to-Have Skills:


	Photography or videography experience (even with a phone!)
	Graphics designing
	Prior experience working with real estate, Airbnbs and housing management.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Portfolio to: hannyonamade@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only candidates close to location should apply.

  "title": "HSE Officer",
  "description": "Elper Oilfield Engineering Nigeria Limited -&nbsp;Our company specialises in Engineering Consultancy, Technical Support services, Manpower supply services, Inspection and quality management (QA/QC), NDT services, production facilities operation and maintenance services, electrical, instrumentation, mechanical, installation and construction services and supply of specialized oilfield equipment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Rivers

Responsibilities


	Enforce the project&#39;s HSSE plan, policies, and procedures on the offshore platform or vessel.
	Conduct regular site inspections and audits to identify potential hazards and ensure compliance with safety regulations and project requirements.
	Conduct toolbox talks, safety meetings, and training sessions to promote a strong safety culture among all personnel.
	Lead the investigation of all incidents, accidents, near misses, and unsafe acts, preparing detailed reports and recommending corrective and preventive actions.
	Ensure all personnel, including contractors, comply with mandatory HSSE procedures, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE).
	Maintain and update all HSSE documentation, including permits-to-work, risk assessments, and incident reports.
	Monitor environmental conditions and activities to prevent pollution and ensure compliance with environmental regulations.
	Act as a point of contact for all HSSE-related issues and concerns on-site.
	Liaise with the onshore HSSE team and client representatives to report on site safety performance and address any issues.
	Lead by example to drive safety awareness and assure safe workplace practices are followed at all times.


Requirements


	A relevant professional certification in Health and Safety (e.g., NEBOSH, IOSH) is required, and a Degree in a related field is an advantage.
	A minimum of 8 years of experience as an HSSE professional, with at least 4years specifically in an offshore oil and gas environment, with a proven track record of working on the Bonga FPSO.
	Proven experience implementing safety programs for maintenance, construction, and turnaround projects.
	The candidate must hold valid offshore certifications such as BOSIET, OSP, and a valid medical certificate.
	This position requires working in a challenging offshore industrial environment on platforms or vessels


Skills:


	Strong knowledge of HSSE regulations, standards, and best practices in the oil and gas industry.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively train, influence, and communicate with a diverse workforce.
	Strong ability to conduct risk assessments, incident investigations, and safety audits.
	Excellent organizational and documentation skills for maintaining accurate records and reports.
	Leadership skills to promote a proactive safety culture.
	Proficiency in interpreting and implementing HSSE policies and procedures.
	Willingness to work in a demanding offshore environment.


Method of Application

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Officer
Job Location: Rivers

	Conduct regular site inspections and audits to identify potential hazards and ensure compliance with safety regulations and project requirements.
	Conduct toolbox talks, safety meetings, and training sessions to promote a strong safety culture among all personnel.
	Lead the investigation of all incidents, accidents, near misses, and unsafe acts, preparing detailed reports and recommending corrective and preventive actions.
	Ensure all personnel, including contractors, comply with mandatory HSSE procedures, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE).
	Maintain and update all HSSE documentation, including permits-to-work, risk assessments, and incident reports.
	Monitor environmental conditions and activities to prevent pollution and ensure compliance with environmental regulations.
	Act as a point of contact for all HSSE-related issues and concerns on-site.
	Liaise with the onshore HSSE team and client representatives to report on site safety performance and address any issues.
	Lead by example to drive safety awareness and assure safe workplace practices are followed at all times.


Requirements


	A relevant professional certification in Health and Safety (e.g., NEBOSH, IOSH) is required, and a Degree in a related field is an advantage.
	A minimum of 8 years of experience as an HSSE professional, with at least 4years specifically in an offshore oil and gas environment, with a proven track record of working on the Bonga FPSO.
	Proven experience implementing safety programs for maintenance, construction, and turnaround projects.
	The candidate must hold valid offshore certifications such as BOSIET, OSP, and a valid medical certificate.
	This position requires working in a challenging offshore industrial environment on platforms or vessels


Skills:


	Strong knowledge of HSSE regulations, standards, and best practices in the oil and gas industry.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively train, influence, and communicate with a diverse workforce.
	Strong ability to conduct risk assessments, incident investigations, and safety audits.
	Excellent organizational and documentation skills for maintaining accurate records and reports.
	Leadership skills to promote a proactive safety culture.
	Proficiency in interpreting and implementing HSSE policies and procedures.
	Willingness to work in a demanding offshore environment.
